Question: MySQL MD5 and Java MD5 not equal: :The next function in MySQL MD5(  'secret' ) generates 5ebe2294ecd0e0f08eab7690d2a6ee69 I would like to have a Java function to generate the same output. Butpublic static String md5( String source ) {    try {        MessageDigest md = MessageDigest.getInstance( "MD5" );        byte[] bytes = md.digest( source.getBytes("UTF-8") );        return getString( bytes );    } catch( Exception e )  {        e.printStackTrace();        return null;    }}private static String getString( byte[] bytes ) {    StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();    for( int i=0; i<bytes.length; i++ ) {        byte b = bytes[ i ];        sb.append( ( int )( 0x00FF & b ) );        if( i+1 <bytes.length ) {            sb.append( "-" );        }    }    return sb.toString();}generates 94-190-34-148-236-208-224-240-142-171-118-144-210-166-238-105
